Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Pitcher
Description: Pitcher with a wide mouth, flat moulded rim and neck with concave, slightly flared walls. Bitruncate cone-shaped neck and stable base with ring-shaped foot, triangular in cross-section. Paste of an orangey colour and exterior surface covered with a reddish-coloured coating. There is a painted decoration on the rim and on the body: black bands encircling the piece. The pitcher has two symmetrical handles starting at the rim and ending in the upper third of the body.
